intro: Pilgerochloa, commonly known as the desert barley, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in the Sahel and parts of the Sahara. The plants are characterized by their slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. They are adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Pilgerochloa species are often used as forage plants for livestock in regions where traditional grasses may not thrive.
